text.p: Zhenhai Refining and Chemical Co Ltd said on Monday it had completed part of a project to expand its refining capacity by 8.0 million tonnes per year.
A company statement said it had completed the overhaul of its fertiliser and refining facilities, including an atmospheric and vacuum distillation unit.
The project had so far raised the company's crude oil processing capacity by 1.0 million tonnes and increased the capacity of its delayed coking unit to 1.3 million tonnes from 0.8 million tonnes.
The expansion project aimed to boost the company's total annual crude oil processing capacity to 16 million tonnes from 8.0 million.

The project was funded mainly by internal resources and bank loans, with part of the foreign currency requirement raised through a US$200 million issue of convertible bonds last year, the statement said.
The rest of the expansion project, including the upgrading of a hydrocracking unit and another atmospheric and vacuum distillation unit, would begin as scheduled in the second half of 1997, it said.
Zhenhai Refining, which is 9.9 percent owned by Arco Asia Pacific Investment Ltd, is principally engaged in the production and sale of petroleum and petrochemicals.
